description: Lesotho declared a state of emergency effective from March 18, 2020.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Lesotho - the Honourable the Right Prime Minister Dr. Motsoahae Thomas Thabane, acting in accordance of the Advice of the Council of State has declared that a state of emergency exists in the Kingdom of Lesotho in respect of the COVID-19 pandemic which threatens the lives of people of Lesotho from Wednesday, 15th April 2020 to Tuesday 28th April 2020.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: Lesotho closes borders with South Africa for everyone except for those who transport food and medical items.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: All borders of Lesotho shall be closed except the designated points of entry which shall be open for the purpose of the conveyance of essential goods and services
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
In Lesotho- a person allowed to enter the country during the period of lockdown shall be subjected to a screening process at the designated point of entry. 
-Screening shall be done on people who had travelled to affected countries, contacts of infected people and randomly to general public, 
-Any health personal who has been exposed to a confirmed case of COVID-19 shall be subjected to testing and self-isolation
 -All person providing essential services, obtaining essential services or seeking medical attention within Lesotho, may be subjected to screening. 
Period for which these regulations apply, from 22nd April, 2020 to the 5th May, 2020
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
In Lesotho- a person allowed to enter the country during the period of lockdown shall be subjected to a screening process at the designated point of entry. 
-Screening shall be done on people who had travelled to affected countries, contacts of infected people and randomly to general public, 
-Any health personal who has been exposed to a confirmed case of COVID-19 shall be subjected to testing and self-isolation

Period for which these regulations apply, from 6 May, 2020 to the 19 May, 2020
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Government of Lesotho shall ensure that public places are fumigated and disinfected every fourteen days. An owner or manager of an entity, enterprise or business shall fumigate and disinfect his place of business every fourteen days.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time)

description: Lesotho is extending its lockdown for 2 more weeks from April 22 to May 5.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Lesotho deploys military and security forces to enforce 24hr lockdown.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
In lesotho, All public and private transport is restricted except bus services, taxi services, air passenger transport and private motor vehicles for the purpose of rendering and obtaining essential services and goods; seeking medical attention; funeral services and receiving payment of grants
-
Period for which these regulations apply, being from the period from 22nd April, 2020 to the 5th May, 2020
type_text: Restrictions on transport; both public and private
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
In Lesotho, A person who is identified with symptoms of COVID-19 shall be subjected to compulsory quarantine at a designated place. Any person other than a foreign tourist coming from an affected country with no signs or symptoms of COVID-19 shall be subjected to self-quarantine for a period of 14 days.  
-
Period for which these regulations apply, being from the period from 22nd April, 2020 to the 5th May, 2020
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: A foreign tourist who arrived in Lesotho prior to the lockdown shall remain at his place of temporary residence for the duration of the lockdown and may be subjected to screening for COVID-19  and quarantined or isolated if determined necessary by a health officer at his own cost.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: A foreign tourist who arrived in Lesotho prior to the lockdown shall remain at his place of temporary residence for the duration of the lockdown and may be subjected to screening for COVID-19  and quarantined or isolated if determined necessary by a health officer at his own cost.

description: Lesotho is under three-week national lockdown effective March 30th until April 21st. Full restriction of movement. Only those in essential services like health, security, utilities, banking and supermarkets will be working.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
In Lesotho, all business and other entities shall cease operations during the lockdown period except for any business or entity involved in manufacturing, supply or provision of essential goods and services.
- 
Period for which these regulations apply, being from the period from 22nd April, 2020 to the 5th May, 2020
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Lesotho Prime Minister Thomas Thabane has extended the coronavirus prevention measure- Lockdown by another by two weeks from April 22 to May 5
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: In Lesotho, any places or premise where cultural, sporting, entertainment, recreational, exhibitional, organizational or similar activities are closed to the public. such as- Public Parks and Swimming Pools; Night Clubs; Casinos; Youth Hostel; Discotheque from May 6 to May 19 2020
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
In Lesotho- all gatherings are prohibited except a funeral services of not more than 50 people and a person holding the funeral shall ensure that all safety measures are strictly adhered to.

Period for which these regulations apply, being from the period from 22nd April, 2020 to the 5th May, 2020
type_sub_cat: Postponement of a recreational or commercial event
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
In Lesotho- all gatherings are prohibited except a funeral and religious services of not more than 50 people and a person holding the services shall ensure that all WHO hygiene and safety measures to COVID-19 are strictly adhered to.
Period for which these regulations apply: 6 May to 19 May 2020
type_sub_cat: Postponement of a recreational or commercial event
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
